review_text:
We loved our stay! Kevin was responsive, friendly and made the whole process easy. The location is great — a nice, quiet neighborhood with close access to restaurants and shopping.
Kevin’s place was clean and the mattresses were really comfortable. We appreciated that there were block-out curtains too. We slept really well.
With this being in the basement of a shared space, we did hear our upstairs neighbors during sleeping hours, but we simply turned on a white noise maker to resolve the issue.
Definitely recommend!

review_text:
Definitely the BEST place I’ve stayed in a while. The single room had the most comfortable beds and carpet I’ve ever experienced at an AirBnB/Hotel (not exaggerating) and the hosts were seriously so accommodating and kind. I could not recommend this room ENOUGH. I’m so glad we chose to crash here instead of anywhere else.
The room had it’s own locked door and private bathroom and the house was super quiet! The blinds kept the room super dark and the brand new TV had everything you could need!
Side Note: We were headed to a wedding the next morning and the hosts proactively offered to go BUY an iron early in the morning if we needed one. They seriously went above and beyond in every way.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Cons: Jay and Sandra were slow to respond on the AirBNB app and their phone number listed was incorrect. I arrived plenty after the check-in time and the hosts were not home. Typically, this isn’t an issue with most AirBNBs as most tend to have a keypad lock, but this one was a regular lock to which we had no key for access until after we were let in. I was not aware of this situation before check-in. I messaged the hosts an hour and a half prior to arrival as well.
Pros: Jay and Sandra were very welcoming, and the breakfast they offered was delicious (especially the strawberry jam). The bed was *very* comfortable!

We've stayed in some other AirBnB basement rentals which have had separate entries and doors that separated the basement from the upstairs so we kind of assumed that going in. However there wasn't a separate entry for us nor a door that separates the basement area from the upstairs. The host also mentioned there was another lady renting one of the other bedrooms there in the basement and that we probably wouldn't see her - and we didn't. So not quite the same feeling of privacy as we've had with other basement rentals. Again, a very pleasant place to stay with warm and gracious hosts.

review_text: The room was comfortable and spacious with a bathroom right next to it. The hosts were nice, polite, and helpful, though at the same time they asked some odd questions and seemed slightly suspicious of us, which felt uncomfortable. They were kind to let us use their kitchen and store food in the fridge as well as do laundry. The house is large and new and located in a nice neighborhood. The location has convenient access to Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks, about 2 hours away from each, and is a great place to stay without paying the high prices of the gateway communities. The room was clean, and though the cleanliness of the kitchen and bathroom suffered a bit, it was OK. Overall it was great value for the price.

Sandra and Jay were very kind to offer breakfast
Place was clean
We found beds to be uncomfortable, smaller ones wobble a-lot.
Although it was a shared unit, the bathroom had no locks and had ants moving around.
The room is in the basement.
The only way to checkin is to call Jay.
Response on airbnb messaging platform was negligible.
Reading reviews one can definitely say that Jay and Sandra are very kind people. The host came to the room to ask for breakfast without any notice..although the gesture was great but we got little scared with no sense of privacy.
I cannot deny that Jay and Sandra are amazing people , and i hope the feedback is taken constructively.

review_text: If you’re looking for a quiet place to spend the night look no further! My friend and I stayed in Jay and Sandra’s home on our recent visit to Rexburg. The beds were comfortable and their home was very clean. They prepared a tasty breakfast for us, including toast made with homemade wheat bread and apricot freezer jam. They even grind their own flour! Their home is just a few short minutes away from the Rexburg Temple which was the reason for our visit. Jay and Sandra were very quick to respond to the questions I had before our trip regarding road conditions in the area in the winter. They were gracious hosts and we will definitely stay with them the next time we’re in town!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I would have to agree with all the past reviews...Jay and Sandra are delightful! We had such an enjoyable stay with them. And as so many others have commented, the breakfast was the highlight of the stay! Not just the most delicious food each morning, but the chance to become acquainted with Sandra and Jay and the other guests. That feel of a true bed and breakfast that is no longer so available. The wheat was freshly ground the morning of our first breakfast to make delicious whole wheat blueberry muffins. Eggs and sausage. Fresh fruit. Whole wheat bread. Just such a treat!
The location is fantastic! I don’t think I could have found a better location. Just a few minutes from the temple and the university. Plenty of parking. Located on a quiet, pretty street. Our room was great! Exactly what we needed! I am so pleased to have discovered Sandra and Jay and their home. I hope to stay here often in the future. Thank you!!

The two families share a bathroom, and the bathroom is small and poor, although the owner offers to use the bathroom upstairs, I think that it is basically not used.
The owner is a Mormon, provides breakfast and participates in their prayer ceremony, as a tourist or a good experience, the owner also sent a book about Mormonism as a gift.

Group trip
review_text: We really enjoyed our stay at this property! The property was clean, well-appointed, and very well-managed. The location is excellent! Walking distance to some great restaurants (be sure to check out Righteous Slice pizzeria), Porter Park, and BYUi Campus. We would definitely stay here again! For those not familiar with Porter Park, it is a great city park featuring toys and a really great splash pad for younger children. It also has a walking path, tennis and basketball courts, and even a carousel (all activities free except a small cost for the carousel). Be aware that the unit we stayed in is located on the third floor, but there is a nice elevator in the central part of the complex if needed for getting heavier bags, etc. up to the third floor.

The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful. The only downside is that the kitchen counter was a bit cluttered with plants, which forced me to adjust my eating location, but this is such a minor nitpick that it's not worth taking a star off the overall rating. This will almost definitely be my first choice if I come through Rexburg again.

We really enjoyed Carolyn's and Cody's presence and willingness to help. They had insightful recommendations about what to visit.
The house is located up the hill in a clean and quiet neighborhood where there are lots of green spaces thus the air being super fresh.
We had everything that we needed, the room and bathroom were very clean.
We had a great time, plus their cute dogs made our stay sweeter. 💓
I would highly recommend this hidden gem If you visit Rexburg.
Looking forward to visit again sometime in the future! :)
Cheers,
Andrei & Andreea

Group trip
review_text: This is a really nice apartment. We loved it. Very nice furniture and so many things for your convenience. For example my wife and I each had our own small table with a lamp at each side of our bed. The lamp had plug ins for a 110 volt and a USB phone charger. In addition, the table itself had additional plug ins built into the table! We both were able to plug in our laptop AND phone; and still had extra plug ins. So convenient and handy. The WiFi was nice too. They didn't skimp on the bed either. It was a great mattress with good pillows and I slept like a log. I liked the shower. It had the upgraded double shower head. One showerhead was detachable and handheld. Good water pressure. Nice towels and plenty of them. We didn't do any cooking but the kitchen looked pretty nice. We were there with another couple and they said their bed was good too. I'm looking forward to staying here in the future.

name: Anne

,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Totally amazing stay! I don’t even know where to start! It is the most picturesque Airbnb we’ve stayed at so far. Just gorgeous! First thing my kids did was jump out to visit the horses. Then to the swings surrounding the fire. The owner lives next door and was extremely accommodating. He treated us like family, it was so cool! The lock was easy to use, and taking shoes off wasn’t a big deal since everything was easily accessible once you entered the house. Plenty of beds for the whole family. And they were so comfy! The downstairs family room and upstairs family/Rec room were all perfect size for our family reunion get togethers. It almost felt like the owners decorated and set up this house just for us! It felt like home! Piano, rocking chair, a place for everyone to spend time with who they wanted to. Just enough TVs. The kitchen was a little small for all of us, but we took it outside and that was so perfect sitting under the stars with twinkle lights above and fire in the middle as we swayed on the swings. I loved that the kids could play games upstairs and the adults could play games downstairs. So yeah, I hope we get to come again!

Group trip
review_text:
Sam's home was exactly what our family needed. plenty of space for a huge family, all the indoor amenities of a modern house, great water pressure, reclining sofas and every bed was comfortable! Although the location is a couple miles into the country it's also only a couple miles from the north end of town, Wal-Mart, the Teton River, Henry's Fork River, and not far from the Salmon River! It's also conveniently located from restaurants, fast food and BYU-I.
The Rexburg Temple is an easy 20 min drive, which was good for our wedding group. It eased some of the stress I had about getting everyone to my daughter's wedding.
Sam's house is clean and he doesn't ask tenants to do much cleanup beyond sheets, towels, kitchen messes and any blood on the walls after a fierce ping pong tournament!!! (Just teasing, my adult brothers behaved at ping pong while their kids tried to catch chickens!)
The kitchen has plenty of space for prep, cooking and eating and has the cooking equipment we needed for cooking breakfast for 30 and other smaller meals.
We're glad that we found Sam's listing, but my 4 sisters got upset that we 6 brothers were discussing a return trip to fish the local waters! So, the next trip to Sam's may be a family reunion when the weather is warm and we can enjoy the excellent grill patio and amazing firepit!
Thank you, Sam! We hope to see you again.
To all y'all looking, I highly recommend it!

Stayed with kids
review_text: This was a nice place in the country, so green, and the chickens and horses were nice to see. It was also nice to have well water to drink. The owner is also very patriotic and has inspirational sayings all over the house. We loved it! The fire pit was the bomb with the hammocks and swings. We had the best flame broiled hamburgers! Suggestion: bring your own wood, or an axe to chop some huge logs they already have there, so they will burn. Also bring a grate with legs if you want to BBQ over the fire. The house is great for kids with a ping pong table and basketball game and 2 tv’s! Also there is lots of lawn to run around on, enough to play soccer on if you have enough players. There are 2 big very friendly dogs who bark at anything passing by, giving plenty of protection, so nothing will bother you at night. Definitely recommend!

The fire pit area we enjoyed the last night is just such a great place to be & hang out together. The upstairs game room is also a great gathering place, and we enjoyed playing games there together. Any question or concern was quickly answered, and Sam bent over backwards to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I can do nothing but recommend this place highly.

They kept the drive and stairs to the apartment cleared of snow. Beds were okay, mattresses and pillows aren't supportive. Kitchen is fairly well stocked; oil, herbs, pots, pans, etc. They need to add pepper to their seasonings. They have a coffee/tea/hot cocoa maker, too bad the hot cocoa only had 3 packets, so we were shy one and only had it for the first day, but it was a nice thought. Quality of dishes are mostly good. The first night was really quiet and it felt like we were alone even though the hosts live upstairs. The second evening, we could hear various noises upstairs; walking around, dropping things, and other sounds. Overall it was a good experience and we would stay here again.

name: Marcene
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a very nice basement apartment in a house in a quiet neighborhood. We loved the layout and the amenities. The appliances seemed very new and everything was very clean and comfortable. I thought the beds were very comfortable. We could occasionally hear footsteps upstairs but it didn’t bother us. Each bedroom has its own temperature controller and also a separate one near the dining table, so it was nice to be able to set the temperature the way you like it. The fan for the heater in the bedroom with the bathroom was a little bit loud but not too bad—definitely better than the ones that are usually in hotel rooms. The laundry room is also set up like a second bathroom with a toilet, sink and vanity. We really enjoyed each having our own bathroom during our stay. The shower has really good water pressure and a nice shower head but it doesn’t have a way to adjust the volume of water. It’s either on or off and you turn the handle from cold to hot. There were 2 of us and I showered second every morning and ran out of hot water at the very end of my shower (but I like long showers). Just plan accordingly if staying with a bigger group. Overall it is a great place and I would like to stay there again!

name: Taylor
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Joshua was a great host and his property was super quaint and sweet. Super clean/spacious for what we expected, well stocked kitchen that included: spices, coffee, hot cocoa, mixing bowls, griddle, skillet, etc.. Laundry room was stocked with detergent & dryer sheets. Showers stocked with nice shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. Everything about the house was pleasant. ONLY complaints were that we were unaware the house was a duplex. Apparently the basement is an apartment unit. Nobody was there when we stayed but we would have liked to know that prior to booking. Especially considering the door to the basement unit apartment was in the primary bedroom and locked from the basement side—not ours, which left us feeling a bit uneasy just because it’s after-all a stranger’s home and we are in an unfamiliar area. Didn’t love that. Also, the area is pretty boring itself. And if you want to get to parks, the driving back and forth gets old and tiring—especially after long days at them.

review_text: Joshua‘s place was a little slice of paradise! He was one of the best and most communicative hosts I’ve ever stayed with. We had a lot of drama on arrival in town because we had booked an Airbnb elsewhere but that host never sent us the check-in information, so it took several hours of work with Airbnb support to get refunded and re-booked in a new place. By the time we booked Joshua‘s place it was quite late in the evening, but he was wonderful about helping get us in as soon as possible. His rental is by far the nicest we’ve ever stayed in, with beautiful renovations, very nice beds, and lots of fun details like a hot chocolate bar which we really enjoyed. It was also conveniently located extremely close to campus and downtown which made it easy to coordinate with the family members we came to see. Highly recommended!

review_text: This was our home away from home. Everything you may have needed was provided! The fully-stocked kitchen (except food) was great for cooking our meals, the Hot Chocolate Bar was awesome for the cooler weather we experienced, a small snack package was on the island when we arrived, board games for the family, shampoo/conditioner/body wash/hair dryer included, and a washer and dryer are available. And if you do need something, Walgreens and a local grocery store are not far (1-2 blocks). Only an hour and a half from the West Yellowstone entrance and two hours and 15 minutes from Grand Teton, which we planned to visit during our trip. This is only a few blocks away from BYU-Idaho as well, which was great because we toured campus on a rainy day. Overall, this was an awesome find and would be wonderful for anyone staying short or long term. A very family friendly neighborhood! The only con: we could not get the fireplace on the back deck to work, which was not a deal breaker for us. We grabbed blankets from the living room and hot cocoa ☺️

Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Group trip
review_text: We just stayed here last week. It was very easy to find, and super clean. Easy walk to BYU-I for my husband's graduation. The host was very responsive in answering questions , usually responding in less than an hour. There are a few things to note that might be a drawback to staying here. First, the master bedroom is on the side of the building next to a busy street. It was loud and made it hard for my husband to fall asleep. Second, the beds in the 2nd and 3rd bedrooms are not comfortable. The mattresses are not soft. Third, there is only one nightstand in the master bedroom, with a chair on the other side of the bed. The nightstand has no outlet close, and there really should be some sort of bedside lamp so that if you get up in the middle of the night you don't have to turn on the bedroom light. I would still give this at least 4 stars because the host was so responsive, it was extremely clean, check-in/check-out was super easy, and it was an easy walk to the BYU-I campus.

review_text: This was clean and the bed in the master was comfortable. The unit is on the ground floor and used to be student housing. The bathrooms are all in the same hallway with shared sinks. It seemed to be poorly insulated as I could hear the upstairs neighbors day and all night. They were noisy, though I don’t think they were doing anything other than moving around their apartment. The hot water went out for about 24 hrs. The hosts were responsive and working to get a plumber in but I was leaving so I asked them to wait until I checked out. By the morning I left the hot water was working again.

It took me a few nights to get used to it. There was no night stand next to the bed but I moved the little desk from the foot of the bed in between the 2 twin beds so I could have a place for my bottle of water in my ipad during the night. Also be aware that there doesn't seem to be any sound proofing so you can hear your neighbors walking in and out which is not a super big deal but if you are used to a quiet house with no neighbors it may bother you. With that being said if I were ever in the area again I would book it again.

review_text:
My recent stay at this Airbnb was an absolute dream! From the moment we set foot inside, we were captivated by the impeccable decor and clean ambiance. Every detail was carefully curated, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere that made us feel right at home.
The kitchen was a true highlight - spacious, well-equipped, and ready to cater to our culinary adventures. It was a pleasure to prepare meals and indulge in delightful dishes as we gathered together.What delighted us was that the reality matched the pictures to perfection! The tasteful aesthetics and thoughtful touches were exactly as portrayed. The city itself was an enchanting destination. Our host played a pivotal role in making our stay exceptional. With clear instructions and quick responses, they made the check-in and check-out process seamless. Their attentiveness and willingness to assist with any query or concern showed their commitment to ensuring a delightful experience. I will recommend to friends & family.

review_text:
Fantastic find! This place in a great location close to campus and in walking distance to stores, parks, and restaurants.
It is VERY spacious! plenty of comfortable seating in the main living areas and a nice big kitchen fully stocked with dishes, utensils, pots, pans, linens, and other kitchen basics.
very clean and modern. well maintained and beautifully decorated. The bedrooms were large and the beds were very comfy.
The bathroom area is quite large too and it was nice to have 2 showers and a separate sink/vanity area.
I highly recommend Angel Host and Brighams Mill for your next stay in Rexburg!! You will not be disappointed!!
The hosts are super fast to respond and very kind.

name: Danee
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Upon arrival, we were given the wrong unit. We booked a unit with two king beds and this one only had one. Angel corrected and had us moved to a different unit.
Angel was very helpful throughout our stay. It did stink that she’d have to get in contact with other people for solutions, answers, and needs. Eventually, after a few days, she did provide us contact numbers for people who were local and they were great and very responsive.
One of the nights, a rain storm hit and the fire alarm started dripping water. We did have to put a bowl and some towels underneath. When we notified them, they immediately came to check it out and took care of the situation.
The unit we had was spacious! We loved that it had two toilets, two showers, three sinks, three bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room. It was very clean too. We were missing an ironing board and pans, but I know if we asked, they would have found a solution for us!
Overall, great extended stay. Thank you Angel and team!

review_text:
Don't stay here!
Repeat: don't stay here!
It's a beautiful condo unit in a big complex, BUT it's very noisy because construction workers, college students, travelers are coming/going at all hours. Outside corridors and very disruptive - partying next to us until 2am! Kids jumping up/down above us. Traffic late at night and early in morning. It was like renting a room in a cheap motel ... for Holiday Inn prices! I asked for a 2 night out of 7 refund, but no joy! The site also listed complimentary coffee daily but the host didn't know about that!
NOT A GOOD DEAL or RESPONSIVE HOST.

Stayed over a week
review_text: These are great apartments located right off a main street in Rexburg, close the park, BYU, and the downtown strip. There is a gym on site, which was a big plus for me. There is high turn over here and the only downside is that you may have a noisy upstairs neighbors, but everyone generally turns down around 10 PM. By noisy, I mean people running around above you. Otherwise, the trade off for a little intermittent noise is totally tolerable, because these apartments are stocked with great appliances, utensils, good internet, and furniture. For travelling families, it is good to note that these apartments have large bathrooms, main bedroom, and two bedrooms each with two twin beds, plenty of utensils, large spacious common areas.

review_text:
We were initially concerned that the unit was on the third floor - concerned about climbing stairs with luggage, and especially with the possibility of snow and ice on the steps (plus we're a little on the older age side). However, we were pleased that there was a convenient elevator next to our unit, so there were no problems.
The unit itself was spacious and pleasant. A large kitchen area, a relaxing living area, three bedrooms and a large bathroom area with two separate, private showers and toilets.
It was also convenient to most local restaurants and eating places.
We will definitely book here again when we need a place in the Rexburg area.

review_text: These apartments are very roomy and nice. Some very minor improvements could make this a 5 star rating across the board. Our particular until was located right next to the stairwell and twobof the bedrooms back up to the stairwell which is steel and you can unfortunately hear people going up and down the stairs in the early morning and late at night. Only one of the bedrooms has a bed that couples can sleep on together although all three rooms are big enough for a queen. The small twin beds in each of the other two rooms are sufficient for rest and sleep but not ideal if you are tall, or married and want to sleep next to your significant other. Overall it's a great place and convenient location to stay and the accomodations are very clean and nice. I would definitely use them again in the future if I had to.

review_text: This is a beautiful home in the heart of Rexburg, Idaho. Sean was a great host. He communicated very well through Airbnb messaging and text messaging. He was pretty quick to respond and very professional. The check-in and check-out instructions were very clear and to the point. A home manual is provided in the home with instructions on how to operate certain items within the home. There is only one small AC unit in the living room and not throughout the entire house. My family and I had to be mindful of the 8pm-8am quiet time rule because there were also guests who stayed right below us in the home. They are completely separated from where we stayed and we rarely saw the other guests so no issues there. Local grocery stores, fast food restaurants, and gas stations are minutes away which is nice. Overall, my family and I enjoyed our stay here.

Rating, 4 stars

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Pros: Very clean and comfortable place for our family of 5. We enjoyed having a garage we could park in with the snow. We also appreciated the spices and oils in the kitchen as we cooked a lot. Night lights throughout the house were awesome as was the phone charging lamps by the bed. Lots of little touches throughout the place. Comfortable couches and beds.
Cons: Could use some upgrades on some kitchen utensils - and again, we cooked a lot so this was a bigger deal to me. Easy fixes though- like the can opener hardly worked at all, some better knifes, a decent cheese grater & a bottle opener. Also, no garage disposal so we had to dig out the food scraps when washing the pans.
The dryer didn’t work well so we had to dry our loads 2-3 times.
It’s bright in the bedrooms in the morning with the sheer curtains, but I just used a sleeping mask and that was fine. There was a noisy neighborhood dog a couple mornings, but what can you do about that? Overall our stay was positive!

Sean's place is very nice and convenient to BYUI and Rexburg in general. It's in a nice neighborhood. Sean lives close by in case his guests need anything during their stay. In fact, I texted Sean and asked if there should be an iron in the house. He was there in a matter of minutes with a brand new in box iron. Highly recommend this place.
Dave
Lincoln, CA

review_text:
This house is in a great location if you are visiting a college student- 5 min from the college, 5 min from eating places and a grocery store in Rexburg. It is in a quiet neighborhood as well.
The house is old but renovated and very clean and comfortable. The sheets on the beds were great - something I don’t usually say about hotel rooms/places we pay to stay. The space is smallish if you plan to have lots of people over, but we did have enough room for our sons and their friends. There is a “quiet time” between 8 pm and 8 am, and if this is difficult because of noisy children, this may not be the best option. There is a downstairs apartment we had to be aware of (take shoes off, no stomping). The kitchen isn’t as fully appointed as some places we’ve stayed, but we still were able to prepare food there without difficulty. All that being said, we did like this house very much.

This place is very clean, well-kept, and convenient. The bedrooms are well-sized and clean. The best thing about this beautiful home was the large amount of common area space, where we could gather & relax. Many Airbnbs in Rexburg have limited parking, but this place has plenty. That was a huge plus for us, because we have multiple children living in the area, and they sometimes braught their friends.
Sean was friendly, polite, and extremely responsive. For example, we asked for extra hangers, and he delivered them to the front door within minutes.
I've stayed in Rexburg several times, and this is easily the best place we've stayed at. If the stars align for my next stay and this home is available, I will definitely book it.

name: Jesicah
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2022
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Nice place to stay for a couple days, especially if you are visiting BYUI. The accommodations are very basic, but comfortable enough for a short term stay. The apartment is conveniently located; within close walking distance to campus. You can definitely hear the upstairs occupants at all times of the day, as this is a modified basement and not a true apartment (lacks a kitchen), but it’s not a deal breaker and the place is fairly comfortable. As mentioned in other reviews, the shower stall is very small and dark. The saving grace is that water gets warm quickly, stays warm, and has adequate pressure-good enough to get the job done. It is worth noting, however, that the bathroom area has no electrical outlets which makes using a blow dryer or curling iron by the mirror very difficult. If those are items you regularly use, prepare to get creative and fly blind, or simply bring an extension cord. All in all, this is a great, no-frills place to stay that includes an off-street parking spot, which is appreciated, especially during the winter months when there is snow on the ground. Communication with the host is easy, as he is prompt, clear, and polite. A reachable and attentive host is a nice bonus, which you will find here.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: You get what you pay for - in a generally good way. This place was nothing fancy, but we didn't need that. There were a few things I didn't expect that we ran into: Although I knew it was a basement apartment, I had not prepared for a fairly steep set of stairs (especially for my elderly mother). Also, being from the south, I expected there to be air conditioning. If it was there, I didn't see a way to control it. But, these things were manageable - and should not have thrown me for a loop at all. Bryce does provide large box fans which kept the air moving, and the stairs are well lit. Little things made it nice, including larger size, plush towels. All in all, nothing fancy, but something just right. Thank you Bryce!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is a nice little place. This was our second time staying here. Last time was for a weekend, this time was for 5 days. We really like that it is our own private living space. It is in a basement but there is a separate entry from outside and you are provided your own parking space right at the top of the stairs.
Because this stay was longer we really appreciated having the mini fridge and microwave for meals and the washer and dryer was very convenient. Also, the WiFi is great. My husband worked online during the days with no problem. The shower is a little small, but works fine and has good water pressure. We would definitely stay here again in the future.
